clockify 0.0.7
  • Reference
  • Changelog

    {clockify}

    clockify

    An R wrapper around the Clockify API.

    The documentation for {clockify} is hosted at https://datawookie.github.io/clockify/.

    API Key

    You’re going to need to have an API key from your Clockify account. If you don’t yet have an account, create one. Then retrieve the API key from the account settings.

    Get Started

    The first thing you’ll need to do is set up your API key. I store mine in an environment variable called CLOCKIFY_API_KEY.

    CLOCKIFY_API_KEY = Sys.getenv("CLOCKIFY_API_KEY")

    Now load the {clockify} package and specify the API key.

    library(clockify)

set_api_key(CLOCKIFY_API_KEY)

    Let’s turn on some logging so we can see what’s happening behind the scenes.

    library(logger)

log_threshold(DEBUG)

    Workspaces

    Retrieve a list of available workspaces.

    workspaces()
    2021-08-30 06:38:06 — GET /workspaces
    # A tibble: 2 × 2
  workspace_id             name    
  <chr>                    <chr>   
1 612b15a5f4c3bf0462192677 Personal
2 612b1708f4c3bf0462192861 Work

    Select a specific workspace.

    workspace("612b15a5f4c3bf0462192677")
    2021-08-30 06:38:07 — Set active workspace -> 612b15a5f4c3bf0462192677.

[1] "612b15a5f4c3bf0462192677"

    Users

    Retrieve information on your user profile.

    user()
    2021-08-30 06:38:07 — GET /user

# A tibble: 1 × 4
  user_id                  email                      name       status
  <chr>                    <chr>                      <chr>      <chr> 
1 612b15a4f4c3bf0462192676 andrew.b.collier@gmail.com datawookie ACTIVE

    Get a list of users.

    users()
    2021-08-30 06:38:07 — GET /workspaces/612b15a5f4c3bf0462192677/users

# A tibble: 2 × 4
  user_id                  email                      name       status
  <chr>                    <chr>                      <chr>      <chr> 
1 612b15a4f4c3bf0462192676 andrew.b.collier@gmail.com datawookie ACTIVE
2 5ef46293df73063139f60bf5 emma@fathomdata.dev        Emma       ACTIVE

    Clients

    Get a list of clients.

    clients()

    Time Entries

    Retrieve Time Entries

    Retrieve the time entries for the authenticated user.

    time_entries()
    2021-08-30 06:38:07 — GET /user
2021-08-30 06:38:07 — GET /workspaces/612b15a5f4c3bf0462192677/user/612b15a4f4c3bf0462192676/time-entries
2021-08-30 06:38:07 — Page contains 3 results.
2021-08-30 06:38:07 — GET /workspaces/612b15a5f4c3bf0462192677/user/612b15a4f4c3bf0462192676/time-entries
2021-08-30 06:38:08 — Page is empty.
2021-08-30 06:38:08 — API returned 3 results.

# A tibble: 3 × 5
  project_id     description    time_start          time_end            duration
  <chr>          <chr>          <dttm>              <dttm>                 <dbl>
1 612b16c0bc325… Setting up Gi… 2021-08-29 05:15:00 2021-08-29 05:27:00       12
2 612b16c0bc325… Make coffee    2021-08-29 05:27:00 2021-08-29 05:45:00       18
3 612b16c0bc325… Populating RE… 2021-08-29 05:45:00 2021-08-29 06:53:00       68

    Retrieve time entries for another user specified by their user ID.

    time_entries(user_id = "5ef46293df73063139f60bf5")
    2021-08-30 06:38:08 — GET /workspaces/612b15a5f4c3bf0462192677/user/5ef46293df73063139f60bf5/time-entries
2021-08-30 06:38:08 — Page is empty.
2021-08-30 06:38:08 — API returned 0 results.

# A tibble: 0 × 9
# … with 9 variables: id <chr>, user_id <chr>, workspace_id <chr>,
#   project_id <chr>, billable <lgl>, description <chr>, time_start <dttm>,
#   time_end <dttm>, duration <dbl>

    Insert Time Entry

    prepare_cran_id <- time_entry_insert(
 project_id = "612b16c0bc325f120a1e5099",
 start = "2021-08-30 08:00:00",
 end   = "2021-08-30 10:30:00",
 description = "Prepare for CRAN submission"
)
    2021-08-30 06:38:08 — Insert time entry.
2021-08-30 06:38:08 — POST /workspaces/612b15a5f4c3bf0462192677/time-entries

    Check on the ID for this new time entry.

    prepare_cran_id
    [1] "612c7cd0a34530476ab25d9f"

    Confirm that it has been inserted.

    time_entries("612b15a4f4c3bf0462192676", concise = FALSE) %>%
  select(id, description, time_start, time_end)
    2021-08-30 06:38:08 — GET /workspaces/612b15a5f4c3bf0462192677/user/612b15a4f4c3bf0462192676/time-entries
2021-08-30 06:38:08 — Page contains 4 results.
2021-08-30 06:38:08 — GET /workspaces/612b15a5f4c3bf0462192677/user/612b15a4f4c3bf0462192676/time-entries
2021-08-30 06:38:08 — Page is empty.
2021-08-30 06:38:08 — API returned 4 results.

# A tibble: 4 × 4
  id                       description   time_start          time_end           
  <chr>                    <chr>         <dttm>              <dttm>             
1 612b17ff5287f7468e701971 Setting up G… 2021-08-29 05:15:00 2021-08-29 05:27:00
2 612b184f5287f7468e7019c3 Make coffee   2021-08-29 05:27:00 2021-08-29 05:45:00
3 612b1f4f73ce921672c1134b Populating R… 2021-08-29 05:45:00 2021-08-29 06:53:00
4 612c7cd0a34530476ab25d9f Prepare for … 2021-08-30 08:00:00 2021-08-30 10:30:00

    Delete Time Entry

    time_entry_delete(prepare_cran_id)
    2021-08-30 06:38:08 — Delete time entry.
2021-08-30 06:38:08 — DELETE /workspaces/612b15a5f4c3bf0462192677/time-entries/612c7cd0a34530476ab25d9f

    Confirm that it has been deleted.

    time_entries("612b15a4f4c3bf0462192676", concise = FALSE) %>%
  select(id, description, time_start, time_end)
    2021-08-30 06:38:08 — GET /workspaces/612b15a5f4c3bf0462192677/user/612b15a4f4c3bf0462192676/time-entries
2021-08-30 06:38:09 — Page contains 3 results.
2021-08-30 06:38:09 — GET /workspaces/612b15a5f4c3bf0462192677/user/612b15a4f4c3bf0462192676/time-entries
2021-08-30 06:38:09 — Page is empty.
2021-08-30 06:38:09 — API returned 3 results.
